pr_title: Add `java` -> `go2sky` -> `java` e2e test case, and adapt v3 protocol

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need this file? I think you have the go2sky commitid, should have these already, if we run go vendor or something in the CI process.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Do we really need this file?

go.sum should be kept.
https://golang.org/cmd/go/#hdr-Module_authentication_using_go_sum

I think you have the go2sky commitid, should have these already, if we run go vendor or something in the CI process.

I depend on go2sky with the pseudo-version, which is actually the same as the commit-id effect.
replies.author: arugal

replies.bodyText: My point is, you have the go2sky commit I'd already, you should be able to regenerate all these. Otherwise, how users use our repo?
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I know this file is needed, but not hosted
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Users can use it by adding it to go.mod.
replies.author: arugal

replies.bodyText:
I think you haven't followed my point. Let's talk in this way, one day, user came to the go2sky repo, he didn't need anything rather than standard Go env. Right? He could do git clone, And more commands to make things ready. Now, we have commit ID file, we should not maintain this file in main repo.
Is this clear now?
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: We need to update this once go2sky updated, right?
timeline.author: wu-sheng
